result.execSummary:
The defendant Curtis A Wimpie was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample by 3:00pm on July 20th, 2022 and pay the DNA surcharge.
Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges during the term of probation. 
Court waived all NON-MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges.
Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
Any cash bond on deposit to be applied.
No possession or use of firearms.

Contact the Probation and Parole Office by 5:00pm on July 20th, 2022.
Complete a firearm safety course.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Curtis A Wimpie

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Curtis A Wimpie in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a plea and sentencing. Defense informed the court there was a mix-up of dates between counsel and the defendant. Case passed to address remainder of calendar. 
Case recalled at 1:35. Plea and sentencing hearing continued. 
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
Court is in receipt of the; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum and WIS JI- Criminal/Elements of the Offense.
Court finds defendant knowingly and willingly WAIVED his right to have an in person hearing and proceeds remotely. 

AS TO COUNT 1 

PLEA HEARING HELD:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  
Defendant advised that if he is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. 
Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. State consents to the Jury Waiver. Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Court ordered a DNA sample and advised defendant of applicable surcharge. 

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered Defendant to serve 45 DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for 1 DAY time served. Huber privileges to apply for work and eldercare.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for SIX MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
Contact the Probation and Parole Office by 5:00pm on July 20th, 2022
Complete a firearm safety course.
No possession or use of firearms. 
Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court waived all NON-MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample by 3:00pm on July 20th, 2022 and pay the DNA surcharge.
Any cash bond on deposit to be applied. 
APPELLATE RIGHTS GIVEN
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea

Defendant Curtis A Wimpie in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for final pre-trial. Parties have reached an agreement. Defense requests plea/sentencing hearing. Court vacates the 07/18/2022 Jury Trial in Branch 30.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 30.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Curtis A Wimpie in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for final pre-trial. Defense requests an adjournment to allow time to continue negotiating a resolution. Case adjourned back to Br 30.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
State's Witness List received and filed.  bm
State's Motion in Limine received and filed.  bm
Jury Instructions received and filed.  bm

Defendant Curtis A Wimpie in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial date. Case adjourned, Branch 30.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Curtis A Wimpie in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Curtis A Wimpie appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests status conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Status conference scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Curtis A Wimpie in court.   Student Intern Josh Milder under the supervision of Claire E Zyber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/2/22 @ 2p
